Posts.Content: Thank you so much for reply! I know that after 2-3 years comes hormonal resistance.
Posts.Title: NO surgery?

Posts.Content: Hello, friends. My DAD get the diagnose ..64 years old. The manifestation of the disease from August 2017 when there were complaints of difficulty urinating, back pain. A tumor of the prostate is revealed. Biopsy: adenocarcinoma G2, the sum of Glisson 7(4+3). MRI of the small pelvis (without contrast, 01.09.2017): tumor of the prostate is 59 cm3, with spread to the seminal vesicles and parasprostatic cellulose. N + Scintigraphy: the focus in the ischium, however according to the MRI data there are no foci in the bones. by ultrasound of the abdominal cavity - the formation in the S8 of the liver. Within 2 month he received therapy with Buserelin. Reduction of PSA from 24 to 17 (10/11/2017 - after 1st Buselerin 10/23/2017) Diagnosis: C61. adenocarcinoma of the prostate T3N1M0, stage 4. In the process of therapy with buserelin,OMNIC,bicalutamid. Is it normal treatment:hormone therapy 3-4 months, then radiotherapy. Without a radical operation?
Posts.Title: NO surgery?
